title: What are the difference between development studies and economics? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are the difference between development studies and economics? Within economics, development is one of several fields or specializations, with programs called “development economics” or “economic development,” depending on the university. Usually a program called “something” studies is interdisciplinary in nature, drawing from a mix of social sciences and/or humanities fields, so we get Women’s Studies, American Studies, and so on. I would thus assume that a program called “development studies” is interdisciplinary, drawing from economics, as well as from other fields, perhaps sociology and political science. Take a look at specific program requirements to see if this is the case.

I think I understand the question? Development studies look as all aspects of a development, which MAY include economic feasibility, economic impact, etc. Economics is a discipline, a field of study. I’ve done several economic studies including calculating “multipliers” basic business enterprises, impact studies and developed several “market” and feasibility studies for various businesses.
